action.action-desc: Mr. Crowley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to prohibit the operation of certain aircraft not complying with stage 4 noise levels, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Silent Skies Act of 2015.

paragraph.text: aircraft and airport noise is one of the most common quality of life nuisance issues in neighborhoods throughout the United States; and

the chapter 14 aircraft noise certification standard (to be known as stage 5) became applicable to new type design aircraft in 2014 pursuant to an agreement signed by the International Civil Aviation Organization, of which the United States is a member.

section.header: Aircraft noise reduction technology research, development, and implementation partnership

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 475 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Aircraft noise reduction technology research, development, and implementation partnership

subsection.text: The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall enter into a cooperative agreement, using a competitive process, with an institution, entity, or consortium to carry out a program for the development, maturing, and certification of aircraft technology that will assist in-service and in-production civil turbojets that have noise levels greater than the levels specified in stage 4 noise standards in complying with such noise standards, as required under subchapter II of this chapter, or more stringent noise standards.
The Administrator may include in a cooperative agreement entered into under this section terms and conditions requiring a recipient of funds under the cooperative agreement—

paragraph.text: to conduct activities under the cooperative agreement on a cost-shared basis, using Federal and non-Federal funds; and

to make repayments to the United States of all or a portion of the amounts received by the recipient under the cooperative agreement, if an aircraft technology developed under the cooperative agreement results in revenues for the recipient.

subsection.text: Of amounts appropriated under section 48102(a), not more than $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2017, 2018, and 2019 may be used to carry out this section.
Beginning in fiscal year 2017, the Administrator shall publish an annual report on the program established under this section until completion of the program.
The analysis for such subchapter is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 47511. Aircraft noise reduction technology research, development, and implementation partnership.

section.header: Prohibition on operating certain aircraft not complying with stage 4 noise levels

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 475 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Limitation on operating certain aircraft not complying with stage 4 noise levels

subsection.text: Not later than December 31, 2016, the Secretary of Transportation, in consultation with the International Civil Aviation Organization, shall issue regulations to establish minimum standards for civil turbojets to comply with stage 4 noise levels.
The Secretary shall issue regulations to ensure that, except as provided in section 47529—

paragraph.text: 25 percent of the civil turbojets with a maximum weight of more than 75,000 pounds operating after December 31, 2022, to or from airports in the United States comply with the stage 4 noise levels established under subsection (a);
50 percent of such turbojets operating after December 31, 2027, to or from airports in the United States comply with the stage 4 noise levels;
75 percent of such turbojets operating after December 31, 2032, to or from airports in the United States comply with the stage 4 noise levels; and
100 percent of such turbojets operating after December 31, 2037, to or from airports in the United States comply with the stage 4 noise levels.

The Secretary shall request the International Civil Aviation Organization to add to its Work Programme the consideration of international standards for the phase-out of aircraft that do not comply with stage 4 noise levels.

The Secretary shall enforce the requirements of this section with respect to foreign-flag aircraft only to the extent that such enforcement is consistent with United States obligations under international agreements.

each air carrier shall submit to the Secretary an annual report on the progress the carrier is making toward complying with the requirements of this section and regulations issued to carry out this section; and
the Secretary shall submit to Congress an annual report on the progress being made toward that compliance.

Nothing in this section may be construed to require the recertification of a civil turbojet that has been retrofitted to comply with or otherwise already meets the stage 4 noise levels established under subsection (a).

paragraph.header: Means of demonstrating compliance with stage 4 noise levels
paragraph.text: The Secretary shall specify means for demonstrating that an aircraft complies with stage 4 noise levels without requiring recertification.

section.header: Standards for issuance of type certificates

subsection.header: Applicability of stage 5 noise standards to civil turbojets with a maximum weight of more than 75,000 pounds
subsection.text: On and after December 31, 2017, the Secretary of Transportation may not issue a type certificate for a civil turbojet with a maximum weight of more than 75,000 pounds unless the person applying for the type certificate demonstrates that the civil turbojet complies with stage 5 noise levels.

subsection.header: Applicability of stage 5 noise standards to all civil turbojets
subsection.text: On and after December 31, 2020, the Secretary may not issue a type certificate for any civil turbojet unless the person applying for the type certificate demonstrates that the civil turbojet complies with stage 5 noise levels.
